result.execSummary:
The defendant Jalon Amour Nutt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of extended supervision to be determined at the discretion of the DOC.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including DNA. Court ordered that all court  costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

charges.descr: Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling
Burglary Of A  Building or Dwelling

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jalon Amour Nutt

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jalon Amour Nutt in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Jalon Amour Nutt.  Attorney Alexander Geocaris in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to Case 21CF4906; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION to be determined at the discretion of the DOC.

- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (12 pages) commencing April 8, 2022 by Emily S. Rebek.

Defendant Jalon Amour Nutt in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Jalon Amour Nutt in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Due to the defendant's lower pending matter, this case is retabbed to Judge Sanders, Br. 28. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: P.O. Samuel Schwabenlander - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jalon Amour Nutt not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MCS or her residence
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jalon Amour Nutt in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Jalon Amour Nutt in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jalon Amour Nutt appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  AS TO COUNT 1: Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
